svcproc.title: Tie Rod End Lubrication
svcproc.para: This procedure refers to all tie rod ends on Meritor non-drive steering axles.

step1.para: Turn the vehicle wheels straight ahead (Figure 69).
Wipe the zerk fitting clean with shop towels.
Wipe the seal/boot clean with shop towels.
Attach a grease gun to the zerk fitting. Either a hand or air pressure grease gun is acceptable. If using air pressure, do not exceed 150 psi (1035 kPa).
Discolored old grease should come out of the purge holes near the boot crimp or bellows area (typically three or more places) (Figure 70).

figure.caption: Figure 70. Old Grease Should Come Out of Purge Holes

calloutgroup.callout1: A. SLIDING SEAL TIE ROD ENDS
B. NON-REMOVABLE AND ALL-WEATHER BOOT SEAL TIE ROD ENDS
1. TRW - LUBE PURGES EVENLY FROM BASE OF BOOT
2. O AND S - LUBE PURGES FROM THREE HOLES TOP OF BOOT
3. TRW - LUBE PURGES FROM BOOT BASE IN EVEN, SMALL STREAMS
4. URRESKO - LUBE PURGES FROM TOP OF BOOT
5. O AND S - LUBE PURGES FROM THREE HOLES TOP OF BOOT

step1.para: If the tie rod end is designed for lube service and it does not accept grease:

step2.para: Inspect the threaded zerk fitting hole in the tie rod end and remove any obstructions.

note.para: Synthetic lubes are not yet approved for tie rod end lubrication.

step1.para: Apply grease until all old grease is purged from the boot.
